chunks.en: Are there any friends who have used Semaglutide for weight loss?

Middle-aged spread with excessive body fat. I've succeeded in losing weight before, just by controlling my diet, but it's too difficult. My exercise volume meets the standards, and I go to the gym every week, but I really can't control my mouth.

Recently, I saw that Semaglutide seems to have an oral version. Has anyone used it? Tell me about the effects and side effects.
I believe that using medication privately without a doctor's guidance is a sign of respect and responsibility for my health.
@goodman111 Is there a source for the statement 'Nearly 50% of hospital diagnoses are incorrect'?

I used to be diagnosed with diabetes, plus overeating, and gained weight for a while. Later, I ran like crazy for 3 months and lost more than 40 pounds, but then my knees broke and I had anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction (which had nothing to do with running), but later I basically couldn't run anymore.

Then I started weightlifting. At first, I was really addicted. I persisted for a year and my muscles were strong, but then I was forced to go back to working more than ten hours a day, not sleeping, not exercising, and driving for long periods of time, and as a result, everything was ruined again and my blood sugar also rose.
The first time I switched to injections was before the surgery. In order to control blood sugar, I had to inject insulin. After the surgery, the doctor prescribed liraglutide, one injection a day.

I couldn't eat at all after the injection. My boss was crazy and thought I was doing it on purpose, fearing that my body couldn't handle it and would collapse (I do the work of four people alone). In fact, this is the result of the medicine. After one year of injections, I lost a little weight, but because I didn't exercise, I had no reaction later.

Recently, I went to the hospital because I couldn't control my blood sugar. The doctor prescribed Semaglutide. At that time, it was relatively new and not a miracle weight loss drug, but only one injection was given per month, and one injection was used for 5 times.

I feel that after the injection, it's like I had reflux esophagitis before. I feel nauseous if I eat too much, nauseous if I don't eat, and nauseous if I drink alcohol. In short, I must eat regularly, don't eat too much, and don't skip meals.

At first, I wanted to vomit when I ate oily food. In fact, after exercising, I don't eat greasy food much anymore, and I hardly eat sugar (I recently started drinking sugar-free Coke). I have always eaten a lot of fruit (I don't eat sour things).

Because of my legs, I can't go out for activities like running or cycling, swimming is also inconvenient, and I can't do thousands of jump ropes at once, so I chose aerobics like walking on a treadmill, plus aerobic exercises.

I recently started weightlifting. After saying so much, I want to tell you that if you want to lose weight, first, think clearly about why, what you want to get, and whether what you are doing rewards you.
Second, don't make it too difficult, it's too difficult to stick to it.
Third, stay away from negative energy, you live for yourself, fat or thin, only your rewards to yourself are the most important.
I suggest you go watch 'YOLO'. Don't care what the filmmakers are talking nonsense about. Just think, in this life, should you live like Zhang San, Li Si, Wang Wu, or yourself?

chunks.en: Do you want to show girls your abs on the beach? Do you want to put on a coat and run freely in the morning breeze? Do you want to control your own life? Do you want others to look at your back and silently say awesome?
@ETiV This ad is so fast and long, give me your employee ID, and the boss will add it in.
Isn't anyone going to correct the original poster that that thing is called Semaglutide?
Soft advertisement at a glance: one account raises the question, and one account writes a lot of replies in a few minutes.
@PbCopy111 You don't really think that long articles like spreading anxiety still have an audience, do you?
@saz #24 If you're not anxious about your own obesity and have to rely on others to spread it, then your heart will give you the answer.
The effect is definitely there. I was 106.2Kg four months ago, and now I am 93.7Kg, with a goal of 80Kg.
Oral medicine should not be available in China yet. The channels I buy are all from the black market...ğŸ˜‚ Hong Kong drug dealers buy medicine from India and sell it to China.
The price in Indian rupees is marked on the medicine box, which is 1/3 of the price I paid.
Side effects vary from person to person: I haven't had any problems so far, but the highest risk is pancreatitis, and I plan to go for a special checkup after the New Year.

A colleague of mine got injections and said that their stomach hurt after the injection and they stopped; a friend of mine also bought tablets under my recommendation and started using them last month. They had some diarrhea at the beginning, but now it's fine.

The English name of the oral medicine is: rybelsus. You can Google it, and you should be able to find a medicine instructions for 'Rybelsus'. If I remember correctly, it should be a Taiwan website, and it is written very clearly, including what side effects and prohibited drugs there are.
@ETiV Ah, the effect is very average. My highest was 106kg, and I lost the lowest to 74kg in less than eight months, purely by starving and exercising.
Of course, obesity is a genetic problem, and it has come back after graduating and starting work.

Anyway, for us fat people, losing weight is a lifelong thing. If we don't pay attention and eat and drink too much, we can gain weight quickly, while some people have good genes and are unlikely to gain weight no matter what. It's enviable and jealous.
@ETiV Thanks
@foxkiller Nearly 50% of hospital diagnoses are wrong, the same all over the world. The sentence that doctors say most often is 'Go back and observe'.
@foxkiller I have weighed the impact of my being overweight, and I feel that it is already greater than its side effects.
If you have thyroid nodules, you need to be cautious.

Also, I have a friend who used this, and the effect was very good at the beginning. When I saw him recently, I felt that the rebound was very obvious. He has been using it continuously for more than 1 year.
@foxkiller There are relevant studies, but I don't think the proportion shown in the research is as high as he said.

chunks.en: How much does it cost? If it's too expensive, I'll just starve + gym exercise. I've been working out for 3 months and my squat is 200 pounds, 194 -> 184 pounds.

chunks.en: @broken123 See if a friend can help mail it to you. Your squat should be 200 kilograms... 200 pounds is only 100 kilograms. I do a 170 kilogram squat, but I can't lose weight, mainly because I can't control my mouth.
Pancreatitis is a very dangerous risk...
This is effective, but if you don't change your diet, it will still rebound.
